abstract: For more than two hours, the mayor parried questions from a lawyer for the consultant accused of stealing $1.1 million from Mr. Bloomberg during his 2009 reelection campaign.
snippet: For more than two hours, the mayor parried questions from a lawyer for the consultant accused of stealing $1.1 million from Mr. Bloomberg during his 2009 reelection campaign.
lead_paragraph: The executive branch paid a visit to the judiciary on Monday when Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg testified for more than two hours in the trial of John F. Haggerty Jr., a Republican political consultant accused of stealing $1.1 million from Mr. Bloomberg during his 2009 re-election campaign.
